snippet: The agency’s taxpayer advocate warned that staff reductions and new filing requirements could make it harder than ever to get an answer on the phone.
abstract: Nina E Olson, head of Taxpayer Advocate Service, releases annual report on performance of IRS and attributes drop in services to taxpayers to budget cuts; warns that taxpayers are being harmed by lack of service, which is expected to get worse due to complications to tax filing related to provisions in new laws like health care reform law.
lead_paragraph: The agency’s taxpayer advocate warned that staff reductions and new filing requirements could make it harder than ever to get an answer on the phone.

headline.main: Need Help From the I.R.S.? It May Take More Patience This Year
